content: pprrooppeerr ttrraappppiinnggss original designs woven ribbon crochet scarf this quick and easy project is a great way to show off an exotic ribbon yarn some ribbon yarns can be stiff or lose some of their beauty when all knotted up into a crochet stitch the scarf is done completely in filet mesh and the ribbon is then woven through using the ends to create a natural fringe materials yarn − a pretty ribbon yarn you are not limited to ribbons intended for crochet try looking in your local craft or sewing store for other choices just be aware that for a scarf both sides of the ribbon will show − a base yarn to match or contrast with your ribbon it should not be so thick that your ribbon will get lost in it or so thin that it gets lost in the ribbon a fingering sock or sport weight yarn works well quantity − one hank of the ribbon you will need much less i used great adirondack featheredge 100% rayon 72 yards in beach house for the blue ribbon scarf and cascade bollicine ischia silk ribbon 64% silk/32% cotton/4% polyamid 71 yards for the yellow ribbon scarf − one hank of the base yarn i used blue sky alpacas 100% alpaca 100 yards for the blue ribbon scarf and art yarns ultramerino4 100% merino wool 191 yards for the yellow ribbon scarf hook up to you but see the notes on gauge below i used an e 3 5 mm hook for the blue ribbon scarf with the sport weight alpaca and a d 3 25 mm hook for the sock yarn in the yellow ribbon scarf gauge this is a project for which you will need to work a bit on the gauge before you start since the actual gauge will depend mostly on the width of your ribbon for the blue ribbon scarf with thin ribbon i used two lengths of ribbon in each square of the filet mesh for the yellow ribbon scarf i used one length through each square in either case each square should be the same width as the ribbon s without either overlap or a large gap start with a hook you would generally use for your base yarn and make a couple of row of filet mesh squares then weave the ribbon through and see how it looks if it is too loose you do not want your ribbon to slide out try a smaller hook if it is too tight go up a size stitches and filet mesh based on a multiple of 3 stitches plus 1 − begin a row with ch5 counts as double_crochet ch2 skip 1st 3 stitches the 1st double_crochet and 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet
